experience.title: Senior Application Engineer
keyResponsability: Within the Hardware team, working on the implementation of event-based Serial and TCP/IP communication between MATLAB and connected hardware. Assisting development teams in identifying software limitations, bugs, and potential improvements.
Within the Engineering Development Group (EDG), delivering high-quality support to MathWorks customers

experience.title: Software Engineer
keyResponsability: Developed C embedded software for high frequency (65kHz) vibration data acquisition and streaming on Texas Instrument TM4C devices.
Setup back-end server for data capture and processing.
Created API for reconfiguring the firmware or reflashing the board.
Managed contractor for custom PCB design.

experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
keyResponsability: Developed a bearing defect detection software using rule-based and machine learning algorithms to process vibration signals in time and frequency domains.
Tested and validated scalability to process around 4 Tb of daily data on AWS EC2.
Supported Georgia-Pacific’s Data Engineering Team to deploy software in production on the company’s servers.

experience.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
keyResponsability: Fall semester Teaching Assistant for Professor Colton’s ME6222 Manufacturing Processand Systems class.
Held virtual and in-person office hours and lectures, prepared lecture materials, and graded homework assignments.

experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
keyResponsability: Validated capabilities of the Process Real-time Units, a fast micro-controller integrated into the Texas Instrument am335x chips.
Released tutorials, Open Source documentation, and examples of embedded C codes for Professor Thomas Kurfess’ team.
Integrated temperature, current, position, and vibration sensors and developed Embedded C Software for real-time condition monitoring of an elevator.
Implemented RF transmission of processed data using Zigbee protocol between the control room and the elevator’s cage.

experience.title: R&D Intern
experience.team: Design and Fabrication of an Additive Manufactured heat management System
keyResponsability: Awarded 'Best Idea of the Year', Innovation Awards 2017.
Designed and prototyped a heat management system for an air-to-air missile using additive manufacturing.
Analyzed the influence of the printing parameters over the final structure and solved computing limits on STL files using Python.

experience.title: Sailing instructor
keyResponsability: Supervised course in light sailing for groups of up to 15 people,ages 6 to 50 years old.
Evaluated navigation risk to ensure safe practice.

key.title: Ph.D. Thesis
key.description: Parallel wavelet transformation for edge and fog detection of bearing defects.
Developed and tested a new method for bearing defects identification using parallel computing at the edge to process bearing vibration data.
Developed an open source I2C driver for Ti-Am5729 Process Real-time Units and interfaced with Linux Kernel for real-time data acquisition.
Developed Federated Learning Simulation Library for centralized and federated learning comparison on the vibration data.
Leveraged recent technology developments on embedded systems to enable real-time data processing at the sensor’s level.

key.title: Courses
key.description: High Performance Computing, Numerical Linear Algebra, Data Visualization and Analytics, Machine Learning, Modeling and Simulation, Computational Data Analysis, Aerospace System Engineering, Aircraft Design.

key.title: Master Thesis
key.description: Developing a smart and low-cost device for machining vibration analysis

key.title: Courses
key.description: Continuum Mechanics, Inelastic Deformation of Solids, Micromechanics of Materials, Manufacturing Process and Systems, Modelling and Simulation in Design, Automated Manufacturing Process Planning, Structural Vibration.

key.title: Courses
key.description: Science of Materials, Machining Processes, Welding, Casting, Forging, Heat Transfer, Computer Aided Design, Statistics, Production Techniques, Industrialization.

volunteering.description: Member of the logistics team for Arts et Métiers’ ski club : organized a 1-week ski trip, 1,200 people, $720,000 budget.
Chairman of the Sailing Association : raised $36,000 in sponsorship.
Member of Arts et Métiers’ student board : Organized over 60 events with approximately 300 participants: sports championship, humanitarian action, and historic building restoration, budget $12,000.
